snippet: A proposal for a monthly broadband subsidy for low-income households is expected to be approved by the F.C.C.’s commissioners later this month.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission will send final proposal to members to approve broadband subsidy of $9.25 a month for low-income households; is part of overhaul of $2 billion phone subsidy program called Lifeline.
lead_paragraph: A proposal for a monthly broadband subsidy for low-income households is expected to be approved by the F.C.C.’s commissioners later this month.

headline.main: F.C.C. Fine-Tunes Plan to Subsidize Internet Access
headline.print_headline: Fine-Tuning F.C.C. Plan to Subsidize Web Access
